channel.title: PDI – PDI namespace reference
channel.description: Recent content in PDI namespace reference on PDI

item.title: Docs: PDI::Array_datatype class reference
item.description:
an Array_datatype is a Datatype that represents an array: i.e storage of multiple elements of the same type continuously in memory.

Member Functions

Array_datatype ( size_t, size_t, size_t, Datatype_uptr )
Construct a new partially filled Array_datatype. More…
Array_datatype ( size_t, Datatype_uptr )
Construct a new completely filled Array_datatype. More…
size_t alignment ()
Returns the required alignment for a type. More…
size_t buffersize ()
Computes the data size of a type, including potentially unused memory from a sparse type. More…
Datatype_template_uptr clone ()
Creates a new datatype as an exact copy of this one. More…
Datatype_uptr clone_type ()
Creates a new datatype as an exact copy of this one. More…
void * data_from_dense_copy ( const void *, void * )
Creates a sparse deep copy of dense data. More…
void * data_to_dense_copy ( const void *, void * )
Creates a dense deep copy of data. More…
size_t datasize ()
Computes the data size of a type, excluding potentially unused memory from a sparse type. More…
std::string debug_string ()
Returns the datatype yaml representation as a string. More…
bool dense ()
Indicate if the datatype is dense or not. More…
Datatype_uptr densify ()
Creates a new datatype as the dense copy of this one. More…
void destroy_data ( void * )
Function used to delete the data behind the datatype. More…
Datatype_uptr evaluate ( Context & )
Creates a new datatype by resolving the value of all metadata references. More…
bool operator== ( const Datatype & )
Test for equality. More…
bool simple ()
Tells if data can be copied as bytes (if type is dense) and doesn't need a destroyer. More…
size_t size ()
Number of elements the array can store. More…
size_t start ()
id of the first actual element of the array More…
size_t subsize ()
Number of actual elements in the array. More…
const Datatype & subtype ()
Type of the elements contained in the array. More…

item.title: Docs: PDI::Context class reference
item.description:
Member Types

typedef Datatype_template_parser
A function that parses a PC\_tree\_t to create a datatype\_template\.

An iterator used to go through the descriptor store\.

Detailed Documentation

name

Result

Description

item.title: Docs: PDI::Data_descriptor class reference
item.description:
Member Functions

Set the datatype template used to type raw pointers shared through this descriptor. More…

Access the datatype template used to type raw pointers shared through this descriptor. More…

Checks whether this descriptor is empty (contains no reference) More…

Return true if the data is a metadata. More…

Sets whether this describes a metadata or not. More…

Access the name of the descriptor. More…

Reclaims ownership of a data buffer shared with PDI. More…

Releases ownership of a data shared with PDI. More…

Shares some data with PDI. More…

Shares some data with PDI. More…

More…

Detailed Documentation

default_type

void default_type ( Datatype_template_uptr type )

Parameters

type
the datatype template attached to the descriptor

Description

Set the datatype template used to type raw pointers shared through this descriptor.

default_type

Datatype_template_uptr default_type ( )

Result

the datatype template attached to the descriptor

Description

Access the datatype template used to type raw pointers shared through this descriptor.

empty

bool empty ( )

Result

true if empty.

Description

Checks whether this descriptor is empty (contains no reference)

metadata

bool metadata ( )

Description

Return true if the data is a metadata.

metadata

void metadata ( bool metadata )

Parameters

metadata
whether data shared through this descriptor should behave as a metadata

Description

Sets whether this describes a metadata or not.

name

const std::string & name ( )

Description

Access the name of the descriptor.

reclaim

void * reclaim ( )

Result

the address of the buffer

Description

Reclaims ownership of a data buffer shared with PDI.

ref

Ref ref ( )

Description

Return a reference to the value of the data behind this descriptor.

release

void release ( )

Description

Releases ownership of a data shared with PDI. PDI is then responsible to free the associated memory whenever necessary.

share

void share ( void * data, bool read, bool write )

Parameters

data
the shared data
read
whether read access is granted to other references
write
whether write access is granted to other references

Description

Shares some data with PDI.

share

void * share ( bool read, Ref ref, bool write )

Parameters

read
whether the stored reference should have read access
ref
a reference to the shared data
write
whether the stored reference should have write access

Result

the just shared buffer

Description

Shares some data with PDI.

~Data_descriptor

~Data_descriptor ( )

Description

item.title: Docs: PDI::Datatype class reference
item.description:
A Datatype is a Datatype_template that accepts no argument.

It represents the memory layout of data and supports some simple operations on it:

  • accessing its content
  • cloning and destruction

Member Functions

size_t alignment ()
Returns the required alignment for a type. More…
size_t buffersize ()
Computes the data size of a type, including potentially unused memory from a sparse type. More…
Datatype_uptr clone_type ()
Creates a new datatype as an exact copy of this one. More…
void * data_from_dense_copy ( const void *, void * )
Creates a sparse deep copy of dense data. More…
void * data_to_dense_copy ( const void *, void * )
Creates a dense deep copy of data. More…
size_t datasize ()
Computes the data size of a type, excluding potentially unused memory from a sparse type. More…
std::string debug_string ()
Returns the datatype yaml representation as a string. More…
bool dense ()
Indicate if the datatype is dense or not. More…
Datatype_uptr densify ()
Creates a new datatype as the dense copy of this one. More…
void destroy_data ( void * )
Function used to delete the data behind the datatype. More…
bool operator!= ( const Datatype & )
Test for inequality. More…
bool operator== ( const Datatype & )
Test for equality. More…
bool simple ()
Tells if data can be copied as bytes (if type is dense) and doesn't need a destroyer. More…
~Datatype ()
More…

Test for equality.

item.description:

Evaluates an expression as a string. More…

Destroys an expression. More…

Detailed Documentation

Expression

Expression ( )

Description

Builds an empty expression. No operation can be used on an empty expression, it can only be assigned to

Expression

Expression ( const Expression & expr )

Parameters

expr
the expression to copy

Description

Copies an expression.

Expression

Expression ( Expression && expr )

Parameters

expr
the expression to move`

Description

Moves an expression.

Expression

Expression ( const char * expr )

Parameters

expr
the string to parse

Description

Builds (i.e.

parse) an expression from a string

The grammar of an expression is as follow:

/* parsing as a REFERENCE is preferred over OPERATION
   parsing as an OPERATION is preferred over STRING_LITERAL
*/
EXPRESSION     := REFERENCE | OPERATION | STRING_LITERAL

STRING_LITERAL := ( CHAR | ‘' ‘' | ‘' ‘$’
| REFERENCE
| ‘$’ ‘(’ OPERATION ‘)’
)*


/* The operator descending precedence order is:


    

  1. *, /, %: multiplication, division and modulo,
    2. 

  2. +, -: addition and subtraction,
    3. 

  3. <, >: less than and greater than,
    4. 

  4. =: equality,
    5. 

  5. &: logical AND,
    6. 

  6. |: logical OR.
/
OPERATION      := TERM ( OPERATOR TERM )
    7. 



TERM           := ( INT_LITERAL | REFERENCE | ‘(’ OPERATION ‘)’ )


REFERENCE      := ‘$’ ( IREFERENCE | ‘{’ IREFERENCE ‘}’ )


IREFERENCE     := ID ( ‘[’ OPERATION ‘]’ )*


INT_LITERAL ~= (0x)? [0-9]+ ( .  )
ID          ~= [a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*
CHAR        ~= [^$\]
OPERATOR    ~= [|&=<>+-*/%]

Expression

Expression ( const std::string & expr )

Parameters

expr
the string to parse

Description

Builds (i.e.

parse) an expression from a string

The grammar of an expression is as follow:

/* parsing as a REFERENCE is preferred over OPERATION
   parsing as an OPERATION is preferred over STRING_LITERAL
*/
EXPRESSION     := REFERENCE | OPERATION | STRING_LITERAL

STRING_LITERAL := ( CHAR | ‘' ‘' | ‘' ‘$’
| REFERENCE
| ‘$’ ‘(’ OPERATION ‘)’
)*


/* The operator descending precedence order is:


    

  1. *, /, %: multiplication, division and modulo,
    2. 

  2. +, -: addition and subtraction,
    3. 

  3. <, >: less than and greater than,
    4. 

  4. =: equality,
    5. 

  5. &: logical AND,
    6. 

  6. |: logical OR.
/
OPERATION      := TERM ( OPERATOR TERM )
    7. 



TERM           := ( INT_LITERAL | REFERENCE | ‘(’ OPERATION ‘)’ )


REFERENCE      := ‘$’ ( IREFERENCE | ‘{’ IREFERENCE ‘}’ )


IREFERENCE     := ID ( ‘[’ OPERATION ‘]’ )*


INT_LITERAL ~= (0x)? [0-9]+ ( .  )
ID          ~= [a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*
CHAR        ~= [^$\]
OPERATOR    ~= [|&=<>+-*/%]

item.title: Docs: PDI::Record_datatype class reference
item.description:
A Record_datatype is a Datatype that represents a fixed number of elements of potentially different types layed out in a specific way in memory.

Each element is given a name to access it.

Member Types

class Member
A [Member]( <compound:classPDI_1_1Record__datatype_1_1Member> ) is one of the elements inside a [Record\_datatype]( <compound:classPDI_1_1Record__datatype> )\.

item.title: Docs: PDI::Ref_any class reference
item.description:
A dynamically typed reference to data with automatic memory management and read/write locking semantic.

Ref_any is a smart pointer that features:

  • a dynamic type system,
  • garbage collection mechanism similar to std::shared_ptr,
  • a read/write locking mechanism similar to std::shared_mutex,
  • a release system that nullifies all existing references to the raw data,
  • a notification system to be notified when a reference is going to be nullified.

{{% alert %}} As of now, and unlike std::shared_ptr, the lock system can not be relied upon in a multithreaded environment. {{% /alert %}}

Member Functions

Constructs a null reference. More…

Creates a reference to currently unreferenced data. More…

Makes a copy of the raw content behind this reference and returns a new reference. More…

Offers access to the referenced raw data, throws on null references. More…
